meanings.definition: To coat or cover with plaster or mortar.
meanings.sent1: The builders pargeted the walls to make them smooth.
meanings.sent2: She pargeted the ceiling to repair the cracks.
meanings.sent3: The cat pargeted the floor with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: The artist pargeted the sculpture with intricate designs.
meanings.sent5: The students pargeted the classroom walls with colorful drawings.

meanings.definition: Covered or decorated with plaster or mortar.
meanings.sent1: The pargeted walls looked clean and neat.
meanings.sent2: The old house had beautifully pargeted columns.
meanings.sent3: The pargeted cake was a delicious masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The garden path was pargeted with smooth stones.
meanings.sent5: The pargeted fireplace added charm to the room.
